newsitem.title: UK: Gene soybean concerns keep rape oil at premium.
newsitem.headline: Gene soybean concerns keep rape oil at premium.

text.p: Concerns over genetically modified U.S. soybeans have put rape oil at a premium over soy oil on the European vegetable oil market.

But the gap between rape oil and soy oil has been closing with the premium of 4.50 to 5 guilders for rape oil over soy down to around 2.50 to 3.50 guilders per 100 kilos in the past week despite news that some German food producers have said they will not use soy products derived from the modified soybeans.
Traders were not willing to forecast an end to the rape oil premium, with much depending on the amount of publicity the GM soybean issue receives.
"At this time of year soy oil should be at a premium over rape oil, but this issue has turned the market upside down," said a trader.
"But the modified beans are not the whole story. The market is technically tight in the nearby positions and that accounts for almost half of the premium," he added.
Others said many buyers would still go for the cheaper product which at the moment is soy oil. --Jim Ballantyne, London Newsroom +44 171 542 8062
